intro: Albertisia megacarpa, commonly known as the giant fruit tree, is a species native to the island of Madagascar. It is characterized by its large, woody fruits that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other economically important species like the cashew and mango. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a rough texture with a distinct odor. The plant is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat.
